intro: Collococcus glaber, commonly known as the smooth collococcus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
